description: A CoreControl control is an object contained in a Core Control module. Modules expose these controls so an adapter can map them between a model and a surface. The valueNumber and valueString are special properties intended for fast realtime mapping. The other properties are metadata that adapters use to implement the mapping.

sendType.description: The type of control messages that are broadcast by this control to adapters. This helps and adapter map it to a different module.

receiveType.description: The type of control message it will receive. This helps and adapter map it to a different module. Typically, a model modules receives the same type that is sent. Often, a surface module uses a different type. For example, a surface may send delta values with a rotery encoder but receive continuous values for display.

name.description: A readable name such as 'Fader.' It can be localized and change freely.

default.description: The default value of the control

units.description: The string displayed after a numerical value such as 'dB' or 'kHz.'

color.description: A CSS color value for application specific use.

displayMode.description: An array of keywords that can be used to represent the control in a useful manner.
